definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Remember, the same heat that melts butter also hardens clay.
sentences.chinese: 請記住，熱可以融化黃油也可以使陶土變硬。

sentences.english: Real clay was Seaman's first specialty.
sentences.chinese: 真正的陶土專業是希曼的第一個專業。

sentences.english: Marcella says that God is the potter molding the clay.
sentences.chinese: 瑪塞拉說上帝是一位塑造陶土的陶工。

sentences.english: The colours were dry and burnt, like the colours in pottery.
sentences.chinese: 顏色是乾燥焦枯的，就像陶土的顏色。

sentences.english: Deep terra cotta shade with a soft copper and gold shimmer.
sentences.chinese: 深陶土色帶柔和的古銅和金色光芒。
它們是陶土燒製而成的。

sentences.english: It's hard to get clay targets.
It's called clay only because its consistency is similar.
sentences.chinese: 把它稱爲陶土是因爲它們的化學成分有些類似。

sentences.english: The Etruscans created fine art with terra cotta, orbakbaked clay.
sentences.chinese: 伊特魯利亞人用陶器或陶土來製作藝術品。

definition: black eggshell pottery (of the Neolithic Longshan culture)
to make ceramics (on a potter's wheel)
white pottery (of Shang Dynastry 16-11th century BC)
